subject: Re: [junit] catching Throwables (Was:  Should JUnit determine if assert*/fail is called in testFoo?)
msgSnippet: Agreed with you Vladimir. It communicates way better the intention of the test. I was explaining why I didn t think to do it the right way first. Now I see the
messageBody:
Agreed with you Vladimir. It communicates way better the intention of the
test.

I was explaining why I didn't think to do it the right way first. Now I see
the light ;)

mathieu

----- Original Message -----
From: Vladimir Bossicard
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, May 23, 2002 6:24 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] catching Throwables (Was: Should JUnit determine if
assert*/fail is called in testFoo?)


> agreed it is clearer. for me it's obvious that it is the same.

For *you*. Chances are that somebody else will have to maintain the
code _and_ tests you have written. It may be not obvious for this
person and he may simply delete the test if it fails and he doesn't see
the purpose of the test.

-Vladimir
